intro: Schizanthoseddera schizantha, commonly known as the common beggar's-tick, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts when mature. Schizanthoseddera schizantha is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and fields, and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
